formItem.itemTitle: The product is based on an End Device Role Type

formItem.itemDescription: DUT can be included as a secure device by any controller supporting the Security Command Class.
formItem.itemNote: Note: There are multiple test cases assigned to this form item. Please make sure to follow the links in the Comments section of the attached Wiki page.

formItem.itemTitle: The product is based on a Controller Role Type

formItem.itemDescription: The controller can be included as a secure device by any controller of any type or manufacturer supporting the Security Command Class.
formItem.itemNote: Note: There are multiple test cases assigned to this form item. Please make sure to follow the links in the Comments section of the attached Wiki page.

formItem.itemDescription: The controller can include as secure devices, compliant controller and slave nodes of any type from any manufacturer as long as they support the Security Command Class.
formItem.itemNote: Note: There are multiple test cases assigned to this form item. Please make sure to follow the links in the Comments section of the attached Wiki page.

formItem.itemDescription: Controllers MUST be able to perform Security 0 bootstrapping if they support the Security 0 Command Class.
formItem.itemWikiLink: Controllers MUST be able to perform S0 bootstrapping

formItem.itemDescription: If a controller has the Inclusion Controller role in a network and includes a node that supports Security 0 Command Class only (i.e. does not support Security 2 Command Class), it MUST perform Security 0 bootstrapping immediately after including the node.

If the SIS and the Inclusion Controller both support the Inclusion Controller Command Class, the inclusion controller MUST NOT perform S0 bootstrapping unless instructed by the SIS with an Inclusion Controller Initiate Command (S0_INCLUSION).
formItem.itemWikiLink: Inclusion Controller S0 bootstrapping instructed by SIS

formItem.itemDescription: If an error happens during S0 bootstrapping of an S0 capable controller, the included controller MAY refuse to provide network functions (others than Learn Mode).
The DUT refuses to provide network functions if an error happens during S0 bootstrapping.
In this case, the included controller MUST indicate to the user that it needs to be excluded and re-included in the Z-Wave network.
formItem.itemWikiLink: User information after refusing providing network functions

formItem.itemDescription: The DUT does NOT refuse to provide network functions if an error happens during S0 bootstrapping.

If a controller is included in a non-secure network as an inclusion controller, it MAY start using its own S0 network key and perform S0 bootstrapping with newly included nodes.

A controller MUST NOT start using its own S0 network key if S0/S2 bootstrapping failed.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S0 bootstrapping by a controller included in a non-secure network as an inclusion controller

formItem.itemNote: Note: There are multiple test cases assigned to this form item. Please make sure to follow the links in the attached Wiki page.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Additional S2 Test Cases (all device types)

formItem.itemDescription: After network inclusion, a node MUST consider S2 Bootstrapping as started after receiving the S2 KEX Get Command.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Consider S2 Bootstrapping as started after receiving the S2 KEX Get Command

formItem.itemDescription: If a node times out waiting for security bootstrapping after network inclusion, it MUST NOT consider that bootstrapping failed and MUST consider that it was included non-securely.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Waiting for security bootstrapping times out after network inclusion

formItem.itemDescription: If S2 bootstrapping started and did not complete successfully, a supporting node MAY remove support of its implemented command classes until re-included. Refer to chapter "Command Class Overview" in the Application Command Class Specification (SDS13781) regarding NIF contents depending on inclusion and security bootstrapping.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:MAY remove supported CCs if S2 bootstrapping did not complete successfully

formItem.itemDescription: A node supporting S2 MUST consider any Security Class lower than its highest granted Security Class as unsecure communication.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Consider lower Security Class as unsecure communication

formItem.itemDescription: Certain command classes, such as Transport Service or Z-Wave Plus Info, must always be supported non-securely and present in the NIF if they are supported by a node. In this case, non-secure support requirements are specified in each individual command class definition. A list of these special Command Classes is also available in document List of defined Z-Wave Command Classes (SDS13548), under âAdditional Commentsâ.

By default, a node supporting S2 MUST support its Command Classes only at the highest granted Security Class. If no Security Class was granted, the node MUST support all its Command Class using non-secure communication.
This does not apply to S2 Access Control nodes, which MAY (or sometimes MUST) remove support for some Command Classes if a particular Security Class has not been granted.
A Z-Wave Plus v2 node MUST request either S2 Access Control or S2 Authenticated as its highest key.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Highest S2 Security Class Requirement for Z-Wave Plus v2 nodes

formItem.itemDescription: A Multi Channel Root Device and all its End Points MUST share the same highest S2 Security Class.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Root Device and End Points must share same highest S2 Security Class

formItem.itemDescription: An S2 supporting node MUST comply with the requirements indicated in the subsection below associated to its highest requested Security Class during S2 bootstrapping.
formItem.itemNote: Note: Please select the highest requested Security Class below.
The S2 Access Control Class is the most trusted class and is intended for home access control devices such as door locks, garage door openers or central controllers.

formItem.itemDescription: A node requesting the S2 Access Control Security Class MUST carry a representation of its Learn Mode DSK on itself and/or make it visible on its UI at any time when Learn Mode is enabled.
A node based on a supporting Device Type MUST support its Command Classes depending on Security bootstrapping as follows:
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:CC support after S2 bootstrapping (S2 Access Device Types)

formItem.itemDescription: If security bootstrapped, it MUST support its Command Classes only if the highest granted key is S0 or S2 Access Control Security Class. It MUST NOT support its Command Classes at all if its highest granted Security Class is any other class than S0 or S2 Access Control.
If it timed out waiting for security bootstrapping or S0/S2 bootstrapping failed, it MUST NOT support its Command Classes non-securely.
The above two requirements MUST NOT apply for Command Classes that MUST always be in the NIF.

formItem.itemNote: The S2 Authenticated Class is the 2nd most trusted class and is intended for secure applications in home control deployments.

formItem.itemDescription: A node requesting the S2 Authenticated Security Class MUST carry a representation of its Learn Mode DSK on itself and/or make it visible on its UI at any time when Learn Mode is enabled.
A node requesting the S2 Authenticated Security Class as its highest Class MUST also request the S2 Unauthenticated Security Class when being S2 bootstrapped.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Highest S2 Security Class Requirement for Z-Wave Plus v2 nodes

formItem.itemNote: The S0 Class is used for backwards compatibility with S0 supporting nodes.

formItem.itemDescription: An S2 node MUST NOT request the S0 Security Class if it does not support the Security 0 Command Class.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:MUST NOT request S0 Security Class without supporting S0 CC

formItem.itemDescription: An S2 node MUST NOT request the S0 Security Class without requesting an S2 Security Class.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:MUST NOT request S0 Security Class without requesting S2 Security Class

formItem.itemDescription:
The S2 Command Class defines a Device Specific Key (DSK) that enables authentication as part of the S2 Bootstrapping process.
The DSK can be represented with the following pre-defined formats: PIN code, DSK string and QR code.

The PIN code MUST be 5 decimal digits representing the value of the first 2 bytes of the nodeâs DSK and MUST be constructed according to figure "PIN code format" of the Z-Wave Plus v2 Device Type Specification (SDS14224).

The DSK string MUST be 8 groups of 5 decimal digits, each representing 2 bytes of the DSK, separated with hypens and MUST be constructed according to figure "DSK String format" of the Z-Wave Plus v2 Device Type Specification (SDS14224).
The first five digits of the DSK string MUST be underlined to help the user identify the PIN code portion of the DSK string.

The QR code format MUST comply with the Gen 2 format defined in document Node Provisioning QR Code Format (SDS13937).

The QR code MUST include two TLV blocks: Type 0 (Product Type) and TLV Type 1 (Product ID) as defined in document Node Provisioning Information Type Registry (SDS13944).

Additional formatting requirements for the market certification are given by the Z-Wave Alliance, refer to document Z-Wave Alliance, Z-Wave Security 2 (S2) Product Labeling Requirements.
formItem.itemNote:
Note: The Gen 1 QR code format cannot be used.
DT:00.21.0015.1

formItem.itemDescription: The DSK representations present on a product MUST comply with Table "Mandatory DSK representations for Z-Wave Plus v2 nodes" of the Z-Wave Plus v2 Device Type Specification (SDS14224).

formItem.itemHeader: DSK on the product or UI
formItem.itemDescription: A product MUST have a QR code printed on its outside or on its UI if it supports to be included using SmartStart inclusion.
A product MUST carry or display the DSK string or PIN code.
If the product carries the PIN code representation of the DSK, the product leaflet, documentation or packaging MUST contain the DSK string.
It is RECOMMENDED that a leaflet inside the productâs box, advertises the QR code and the full DSK string.
The DUT follows the above recommendation.
The DUT does NOT follow the above recommendation.
The product packaging SHOULD carry the QR code and DSK string on its outside.
The DUT follows the above recommendation.
The DUT does NOT follow the above recommendation.
The including node or the joining node MUST apply timeouts according to Table "Security 2 bootstrapping Timeouts" in the Z-Wave Transport Encapsulation Command Class specification (SDS13783).
The following items describe additional requirements for controllers supporting Security 2 Command Class
formItem.itemNote: Note: There are multiple test cases assigned to this form item. Please make sure to follow the links in the attached Wiki page.

formItem.itemDescription: A node based on a controlling Device Type requesting S2 Access Control Security Class MUST request S2 Authenticated and S2 Unauthenticated Security Classes when being S2 bootstrapped.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Required S2 Security Classes for Controllers being S2 bootstrapped

formItem.itemDescription: A node based on a controlling Device Type requesting the S2 Access Control Security Class MAY decide to not support a set of its implemented Command Classes if it has not been granted a certain Security Class during S2 bootstrapping.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Respect requirements for highest requested S2 Security Class (Access Control)

formItem.itemDescription: The DUT supports all of its implemented Command Classes if it has not been granted a certain Security Class.
The DUT does not support a set of its implemented Command Classes if it has not been granted a certain Security Class.
formItem.itemNote: Note: Use the text field to list the Command Classes that are not supported in this case.

formItem.itemTitle: Requirements related to Controller network roles

formItem.itemHeader: The DUT supports the SIS network role
formItem.itemDescription: If a controller has the SIS role:
It MUST support the SIS side of the Inclusion Controller Command Class
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Support SIS side of Inclusion Controller CC

formItem.itemDescription: It MUST support inclusion of nodes that implement any combination of Security 2 Security Classes
It MUST have input and display method for support of all Security Classes
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Input and display method for supported Security Classes (SIS role capable)

formItem.itemDescription: It MAY support inclusion using CSA
The DUT supports inclusion using CSA.
The DUT does NOT support inclusion using CSA.

formItem.itemHeader: The DUT supports the Inclusion Controller network role
formItem.itemDescription: If a controller has the Inclusion Controller role:
It MUST support the Inclusion Controller side of the Inclusion Controller Command Class
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Support Inclusion Controller side of Inclusion Controller CC

formItem.itemDescription: It MUST NOT perform Security 2 bootstrapping
It MAY have input and display method depending on supported Security Classes
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Input and display method for supported Security Classes (Non-SIS capable)

formItem.itemHeader: The DUT supports the Primary Controller network role
formItem.itemDescription: If a controller has the Primary Controller role:
It MAY have input and display method depending on supported Security Classes
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Input and display method for supported Security Classes (Non-SIS capable)

formItem.itemDescription: A controller with a user interface for PIN code input (and optionally a QR scanning capability) MUST comply with following when bootstrapping S2 nodes:
It MUST grant membership of all requested Classes if the joining node requests membership of the S2 Access Control Class (unless specified otherwise by a user).
It MAY ask the user for confirmation before granting S2 Authenticated Class key if the node does not request membership of the S2 Access Control Class.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:User confirmation before granting S2 Authenticated Class

formItem.itemDescription: It SHOULD provide a way to inspect and adjust the list of the Security Class memberships that will be granted to the joining node.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Adjustment of granted Security Class memberships

formItem.itemDescription: The DUT follows the above recommendation.
The DUT does NOT follow the above recommendation.
A constrained controller with no QR scanning capability and no user interface for PIN code input MUST comply with following when bootstrapping S2 nodes:
It MUST grant membership of the S2 Unauthenticated Class if the joining node requests membership of the S2 Unauthenticated Class.
It MUST abort the S2 bootstrapping entirely (grant no key) if the joining node does not request membership of the S2 Unauthenticated Class.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Abort S2 bootstrapping if S2 Unauthenticated Class is not requested

formItem.itemDescription: If a node has been security bootstrapped with the S0 Command Class in a S2 capable network, the SIS/Primary controller MUST issue a warning message to the user informing that the node has not been included securely.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Warning if node has been bootstrapped with the S0 Command Class

formItem.itemDescription: The SIS/Primary controller SHOULD request a new NIF to the included node after security bootstrapping to verify if the included node supports S2 before issuing the message to the user.

If an S2 node has not been granted the highest requested S2 key during bootstrapping, the SIS/Primary controller MUST issue a warning message to the user informing that the node has not been included with the highest security. This is OPTIONAL if the user has actively chosen which keys to grant and security bootstrapping completed successfully.
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Warning if S2 node has not been granted the highest requested S2 key

formItem.itemDescription: In an Inclusion Controller scenario, the SISâ UI may not be active during S2 bootstrapping. In this case, the following rules apply:
formItem.itemWikiLink: S2:Warning if SIS UI not active during bootstrapping

formItem.itemDescription: If the SIS automatically grants unauthenticated key for a node that request S2 Unauthenticated Class, it MAY notify the end user the next time it uses the UI.
If the SIS timed out during S2 bootstrapping, it SHOULD instruct the end user that the node needs to be excluded and re-included.
A node supporting SmartStart inclusion MUST enter SmartStart Learn Mode by default when ready after powering up, regardless of network inclusion status.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Learn Mode after powering up

formItem.itemDescription: A node supporting SmartStart inclusion MUST fall back on SmartStart Learn Mode after deactivating classic Learn Mode.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Fallback to SmartStart if classic Learn Mode is deactivated

formItem.itemDescription: The DUT is power-constrained and designed to settle at a higher Max Inclusion Request Interval than the default 512 seconds
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Higher Max Inclusion Request Interval

formItem.itemDescription: The Max Inclusion Request Interval value MUST be advertised in the nodeâs provisioning information.

formItem.itemHeader: Auto-reset - The SmartStart functionality may require a node to self-perform a default reset operation
formItem.itemDescription: A node included via SmartStart inclusion MUST auto-reset if failing Z-Wave network inclusion or if an error occurred during S2 bootstrapping (S2 bootstrapping started and aborted).
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Auto-Reset after failed SmartStart inclusion

formItem.itemDescription: A node included via SmartStart inclusion MUST auto-reset if S2 bootstrapping did not start.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Auto-reset if S2 bootstrapping did not start

formItem.itemDescription: A node included via SmartStart inclusion MUST NOT auto-reset because it is granted fewer keys or no keys at all by the controller during S2 bootstrapping.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - No Auto-Reset after granting fewer keys

formItem.itemDescription: Following auto-reset, the SmartStart node MUST automatically start requesting SmartStart inclusion again.
A SmartStart node included via classic inclusion (NWI or direct range) MUST NOT auto-reset after incomplete Z Wave inclusion or after S0/S2 bootstrapping failure.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - No Auto-Reset after failed classic inclusion

formItem.itemHeader: Support Requirements from Device Type Specification
formItem.itemDescription: A node supporting to be included using SmartStart inclusion MUST have a QR code printed on its outside or its UI. The QR code MUST indicate version 1 (SmartStart enabled nodes).
A SmartStart node MUST carry and keep the same Learn Mode DSK during its entire lifetime.
How to locate the DSK representation(s) on the product.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Documented location of DSK representations

formItem.itemDescription: How to access the DSK representation(s) via the UI, if available.

For nodes supporting the SmartStart inclusion, the documentation MUST include a short description of what is SmartStart.

The following wording is RECOMMENDED: SmartStart enabled products can be added into a Z-Wave network by scanning the Z-Wave QR Code present on the product with a controller providing SmartStart inclusion. No further action is required and the SmartStart product will be added automatically within 10 minutes of being switched on in the network vicinity.
DUT can perform SmartStart Inclusion of other nodes
A controller providing control of the SmartStart functionality is NOT REQUIRED to support the SmartStart functionality and support being included in a network using SmartStart inclusion.

formItem.itemHeader: Control Requirements from Role Type Specification
formItem.itemDescription: A controller providing control of the SmartStart functionality MUST have the SIS role in a network to perform SmartStart inclusion.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller does not perform SmartStart inclusion if it does not have the SIS role

formItem.itemDescription: A controller performing a SmartStart inclusion of another node MUST perform S2 bootstrapping even if it will grant no keys to the joining node or if the joining node does not show S2 in the NIF / Inclusion Request.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller performs S2 bootstapping - no matter what

formItem.itemDescription:
A Z/IP Gateway providing the SmartStart functionality MUST support the following Command Classes on the IP side:
  • Network Management Inclusion Command Class, version 3 or newer
  • Node Provisioning Command Class
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller based on Z/IP Gateway provides control functionalities via IP

formItem.itemDescription: A Provisioning List Entry MUST remain in the pending state for at least 60 minutes before being updated to the passive state.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller leaves Node Provisioning List entry in pending state for at least 60 minutes

formItem.itemDescription: A controller providing the SmartStart functionality MUST keep NWI enabled as long as at least 1 Provisioning List Entry is in the pending state.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller keeps NWI enabled while a list entry is pending

formItem.itemDescription: A controller MUST try to include again a node that has auto-reset itself after a failed inclusion or S2 bootstrapping attempt.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller tries again to include a node after a failed inclusion

formItem.itemDescription: A controller providing control of the SmartStart functionality MUST:
Provide a method for the end user to view the Node Provisioning List entries with their network inclusion status (included/ not included or failed).
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller provides access to the Node Provisioning List

formItem.itemDescription: Provide a method for the end user to manually add, edit and remove entries in the Node Provisioning List.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller provides a method to edit the Node Provisioning List

formItem.itemDescription: Provide a method for the end user to edit available settings for each entry in the Node Provisioning List. (e.g., Inclusion setting, Advanced joining)
Support S2 inclusion with authentication using the DSK PIN code.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller supports S2 inclusion with authentication using the DSK PIN code

formItem.itemDescription: If a user removes a node from the Node Provisioning List and the node is still included in the Z-Wave network, the controller MUST inform the end user that the node will stay in the network and requires to be excluded manually or reset to factory default in order to leave the Z-Wave Network.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller informs if manual exclusion is required

formItem.itemDescription: A controller MUST inform the end user that S2 only (non-SmartStart) nodes present in the Provisioning List require to perform a classic inclusion to add them into the Z-Wave network.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller informs of non-SmartStart nodes in the Node Provisioning List

formItem.itemDescription: A controller providing the SmartStart functionality SHOULD provide a QR Code scanning capability.
The DUT follows the above recommendation.
It MUST support the addition of nodes using QR Code format defined in SDS13937 in its Provisioning List when scanning the QR Code.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller offers QR code scanning

formItem.itemDescription: It SHOULD support scanning of Gen1 QR Codes, refer to Node Provisioning QR Code Format (SDS13937).
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller supports scanning of Gen1 QR codes

formItem.itemDescription: The DUT follows the above recommendation.
The DUT does NOT follow the above recommendation.
The DUT does NOT follow the above recommendation.
For controllers providing the SmartStart functionality, the documentation MUST describe:

formItem.itemHeader: Control Requirements from Device Type Specification
formItem.itemDescription: How to perform a secure inclusion of a SmartStart node (adding the node in the Node Provisioning List and powering up/installing the node)
How to access and edit the Node Provisioning List.
formItem.itemWikiLink: SmartStart - Controller documentation on how to edit the Node Provisioning List

formItem.itemTitle: Control of Preferred vs. Non-Preferred Devices
formItem.itemDescription: This controller implements a "preferred vs. non-preferred" control functionality which provides enhanced control for preferred devices while still providing the required minimum control for all others.
formItem.itemNote: Samples of preferred brands/devices are needed during testing. Please check with the selected test house to determine whether or not they already have samples or if you will need to provide them.
formItem.itemWikiLink: Control of Preferred VS Non-Preferred Devices

formItem.itemNote: Identify the primary user interface for this device

formItem.itemDescription: This is a hand-held portable controller
This controller has an integrated display and user interface
This controller utilizes a web based graphical user interface
This controller utilizes an Android based graphical user interface
This controller utilizes an iOS based graphical user interface
Network Management functionality is included in the application/GUI

Network Management functions (inclusion, exclusion, replication, etc.) are password protected. Any combination is allowed.

A password must be provided to the test partner for use during verification testing.
formItem.itemNote: If the end user will own this device then they MUST have the ability to manage their network. Network Management functionality MUST be included in the application and passwords MUST be provided to the end user if/when requested. A password must be provided to the test partner for use during verification testing.

formItem.itemDescription:
Network Management functions are hidden from end user and only accessible to the owner of the device. This option is only for service providers who retain ownership of network devices even after installation in subscriberâsâ homes.

The test partner MUST be given access to these functionalities for verification testing.

Network Management functionality is not included in the application/GUI.

The test partner MUST be able to test all network management functions.
formItem.itemNote: This device/software provides a limited control application/GUI. This option is ONLY for service providers who retain ownership of network devices even after installation in subscriberâsâ homes. Network Management functions MUST be provided through the assistance of the service provider's tech support. If the service provider's tech support will not provide this assistance then control of the network management functions MUST be given to the end user. If the service provider does not take possession of the device at the end of the service contract they MUST provide the Network Management functionalities to the end user (new owner of the device).

formItem.itemDescription: Network Management functionality is provided through a separate Z-Wave certified application/GUI.
formItem.itemNote: Details and certification number must be provided below.

formItem.itemDescription: It is not acceptable to block interoperability by any means.
It is not acceptable to prevent inclusion of certified devices into a system or force exclusion of non-preferred devices after inclusion.
Devices from non-preferred manufacturers MAY be placed in a special section of the user interface; this section should be referred to as "Additional Z-Wave Ecosystem Devices".

Additionally, it is acceptable to inform the user, upon inclusion of non-preferred devices that the device being included is not part of the vendors preferred ecosystem, and that control and support of the device by the vendor may be limited.
formItem.itemNote: Note: Select this item if such an information is shown to the user.

formItem.itemDescription: It is not permitted to display additional pop-ups, ask for pin codes or implement any other blocking or discouraging behavior for inclusion or control of non-preferred devices.

The Z-Wave Alliance recommends wording as follows. "You are about to include a Z-Wave compatible device that is not promoted by âservice provider nameâ for use in this application. While the device will work as expected the device may or may not support all of the features of the âservice provider nameâ recommended device."

If a controller product supports short range wireless non-Z-Wave technology smarthome products (e.g. light bulbs, thermostats, door locks and the like) and Z-Wave technology products, it MUST, at a minimum, control the following Command Classes:
  • Door Lock Command Class
  • Binary Switch Command Class
  • Multilevel Switch Command Class
  • Thermostat Mode Command Class
  • Thermostat Setpoint Command Class
A controller MUST have a menu or method for an (advanced) end user to request the controller to perform a capability discovery for a given node (i.e. to perform a complete commissioning interview)
formItem.itemWikiLink: Node commissioning interview on user request

formItem.itemDescription: After any device issued a Configuration Report advertising a dynamic capabilities parameter value change, a controlling node MUST NOT perform the node interview unless instructed to do so by the end user.
If such a controlling node does not implement any End Points, it MUST NOT advertise the Multi Channel Command Class in its Node Information Frame (NIF) or S0/S2 Commands Supported Report Command.
A controller MUST generate a new HomeID using a random number generator when creating a new network.
formItem.itemWikiLink: Generate new random HomeID when creating a new network

formItem.itemDescription: When the SIS is present, an including node MUST always assign SIS return route when including a slave type device.
formItem.itemWikiLink: If SIS present, including node assigns SIS return route when including a slave

formItem.itemDescription: If a SIS is present in the network, the destination NodeID of the Lifeline group MUST be the SIS NodeID.
formItem.itemWikiLink: If SIS present, Lifeline destination MUST be the SIS NodeID

formItem.itemDescription: It is RECOMMENDED that a controller does not display a newly included node as ready to be operated during the commissioning phase.
formItem.itemWikiLink: Controller does not display a newly included node as ready to be operated during the commissioning phase

formItem.itemDescription: Z/IP Gateway has not been modified

formItem.itemNote: Note: Provide a description of the modification in the text field below.
Maintained Z/IP Gateway release - Allowed for new products until January 16th, 2021. May be used for re-certifications.
Maintained Z/IP Gateway release - Allowed for new products until August 2nd, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.
Maintained Z/IP Gateway release - Allowed for new products until July 12th, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.
Maintained Z/IP Gateway release - Allowed for new products until March 29th, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.

formItem.itemTitle: Device is based on Z-Ware Middleware

formItem.itemDescription: Device is a controller and Z-Ware middleware has not been modified
Device is a controller based on modified Z-Ware Middleware
formItem.itemNote: Note: Provide a description of the modification in the text field below.
Maintained Z-Ware release - Allowed for new products until January 16th, 2021. May be used for re-certifications.
Maintained Z-Ware release - Allowed for new products until August 2nd, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.
Maintained Z-Ware release - Allowed for new products until July 12th, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.
Maintained Z-Ware release - Allowed for new products until March 29th, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.

formSection.name: Required Documentation
formSection.sectionDescription: The following requirements for end user documentation apply to all Z-Wave Plus v2 compliant products. The documentation may be provided as product manuals, quick start guides, electronic help files, web pages, etc.

formItem.itemDescription: The product documentation MUST use the terminology indicated in Table "Z-Wave Plus v2 documentation terminology" of the Z-Wave Plus v2 Device Type Specification (SDS14224) for Z-Wave related functionality.

formItem.itemTitle: For Z-Wave slave Role Types, the documentation MUST describe:

formItem.itemDescription: How to include and exclude the device in an existing network when using Classic inclusion.
formItem.itemNote: Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: If a node based on a slave Role Type supports its Command Classes only when granted the Access Control Security key, the documentation MUST indicate that an S2 security enabled controller is required to operate the product.
formItem.itemNote:
DT:00.31.000E.2
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemTitle: For Z-Wave controller Role Types, the documentation MUST describe:

formItem.itemDescription: How to include and exclude the device in an existing network using classic inclusion.
formItem.itemNote: Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: How to include and exclude other devices.
formItem.itemNote: Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: How to initiate a replication of network information from the controller to another controller.
formItem.itemNote: Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: How to put the controller into learn mode to receive network information from another controller.
formItem.itemNote: Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: The documentation MUST describe how an (advanced) end user can perform a capability rediscovery of a chosen node.
formItem.itemNote:
DT:00.31.0013.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemTitle: Documentation related to devices from multiple manufacturers
formItem.itemDescription:
The product documentation MUST include a section which describes how products from different manufacturers and product categories can be a part of the same Z-Wave network, and that the different mains powered nodes can act as repeaters regardless of manufacturers.

The following is the RECOMMENDED wording:
This product can be operated in any Z-Wave network with other Z-Wave certified devices from other manufacturers. All mains operated nodes within the network will act as repeaters regardless of vendor to increase reliability of the network.
formItem.itemNote:
DT:00.31.0008.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription:
If the product can alter its capabilities depending on a configuration parameter or based on a user interaction, the documentation MUST include a list of all events that can trigger capability change and describe:
  • How to perform such actions
  • What capabilities are being altered
formItem.itemNote:
DT:00.31.0010.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: The product documentation MUST indicate to the end user that it is necessary to ask a controlling node to rediscover the productâs capabilities after altering capabilities.
The product documentation MUST indicate that it is necessary to re-include the node in the network if the controller does not have any capability rediscovery option.
The product documentation MUST include instructions on how to perform a reset to factory default operation.
formItem.itemNote:
RT:00.11.000B.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: If the product implements support of the Notification Command Class, the documentation MUST specify the implemented Notification Type(s) and Event(s).
formItem.itemNote:
DT:00.31.0015.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: The user guide and installation manual MUST advertise support of anti-theft protection.
formItem.itemNote: Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: The documentation MUST include a description of the association groups available in the product.
formItem.itemNote:
DT:00.31.0009.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription:
Each group MUST include the following information:
  • Grouping identifier
  • Maximum number of devices that can be added to the group
  • Description of how the association group is used and/or triggered by the product
  • Description of any mapping between groups (e.g. Root Device mirrored End Point group)
If the product supports Basic Command Class, the product documentation MUST include information on the usage of the Basic Command Class and the resulting product behavior.
formItem.itemNote:
DT:00.31.0014.2
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: If the product implements support of the Configuration Command Class, the documentation MUST include a description of each configuration parameter available in the product.
formItem.itemNote:
DT:00.31.000B.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription:
Each configuration parameter MUST be listed with the following information:
  • Parameter number
  • Description of parameter and its effect on the product
  • Default value
  • Size (number of bytes)
The documentation SHOULD also list other configuration parameter properties such as read-only or advanced flag, etc.
The manufacturer MUST define which scale and rate types are the default and it MUST be described in the product manual.
formItem.itemNote: Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: The documentation MUST list the supported Command Classes, their version and their required Security class if any.
formItem.itemNote:
DT:00.31.000F.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemTitle: Documentation for Thermostat Setback Command Class
formItem.itemDescription:
The implementation of Energy Saving Mode is manufacturer specific, and MUST be documented in the Userâs Manual.
If the temporary override is implemented it MUST be documented in the userâs manual.
formItem.itemNote: Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemTitle: Documentation for Thermostat Mode Command Class version 3
formItem.itemDescription: â­If implemented, the MANUFACTURER SPECIFIC mode and all of its associated Manufacturer Data fields MUST be described in the product manual.
formItem.itemNote: Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemTitle: Documentation for Wake Up Command Class
formItem.itemDescription: If the node supports the Wake Up Command Class, the product documentation MUST describe how to manually Wake Up the node.
formItem.itemNote:
DT:00.31.000D.1
Specify the location (document, page, etc.) of this part in the below text field.

formItem.itemDescription: In addition to the rules defined above the following technical documentation MUST be made available to the certification test lab upon submitting the product for certification:
formItem.itemNote:
Note: All documentation is provided in English language; or other arrangements have been made with the test lab.

DT:00.31.0002.1

formItem.itemDescription: Documentation about how to activate any functionality available in the device related to Z-Wave behavior.
If any special procedures are REQUIRED to test any item in the certification form, such procedures MUST be clearly described.
If the product is a Z-Wave controller, documentation on how to send any controlled command from the controller MUST be included.
formItem.itemNote: Note: This item is mandatory if the DUT is a Controller.

formItem.itemDescription: The Product Information form on the Z-Wave Alliance website for this case number MUST be completed, submitted and accepted before a Z-Wave Plus v2 certification can be issued.
formItem.itemNote: An automatic e-mail notification will be sent to the Z-Wave certification mailbox when the information has been accepted.

formSection.name: Association Group Data
formSection.sectionDescription: In this section the implemented Association Groups of the DUT are defined. Please enter the same data as in the Association and Association Group Info Reports from the DUT.

formItem.itemNote: The maximum number of destinations supported by the advertised association group.

formItem.itemDescription: The group is implemented on a Multi Channel End Point

formItem.itemNote: This field is used to indicate the assigned name for the actual Group Identifier.
This field is used to advertise the profile of the actual association group. Refer to section "Profile" and Table "AGI Profiles" in document Z-Wave Management Command Class Specification.

formItem.itemDescription: Command Class and Command (multiple byte pairs)
formItem.itemNote: This field contains the identifiers of the Command Classes and Commands which are sent to the Node IDs of the Association Group. Enter the full byte sequence for all group Commands as returned by the DUT. (e.g. 0x20015A01 for a Basic Set and a Device Reset Locally Notification Command). Command Class and Command identifiers can be found in file ZW_classcmd.h file from the SDKs.

formSection.name: Configuration Parameter Data
formSection.sectionDescription: In this section the implemented Configuration parameters of the DUT are defined. Please enter the exact same data as in the Configuration Name, Info and Properties Reports from the DUT.

formItem.itemNote:
This field is used to advertise the name of the parameter. It is RECOMMENDED that the Name field advertises the name found in the documentation.

Note: Please enter the Name string and NOT the UTF-8 byte representation.

This field is used to advertise the detailed information available for the parameter. It is RECOMMENDED that the Info field carries all information found in the documentation.

Note: Please enter the Info string and NOT the UTF-8 byte representation.
This field is used to advertise the format of the parameter.
This field is used to advertise the size of the actual parameter.

formItem.itemTitle: This is a Z-Wave device that contains application software

formItem.itemHeader: Provide the values returned in the Version CC V2 Report in this section. All values are 8 bits (Hex); example: 0x0A
formItem.itemNote:
The Hardware Version field MUST report a value which is unique to this particular version of the product.
  • It MUST be possible to uniquely determine the hardware characteristics from the Hardware Version field in combination with the Manufacturer ID, Product Type ID and Product ID fields of Manufacturer Specific Info Report of the Manufacturer Specific Command Class.
  • The Hardware Version field is intended for the hardware version of the entire product, not just the version of the Z-Wave radio chip.
  • For software application products the version of the used hardware platform should be returned in this field or 0 if the version can not be determined.
Firmware 0 is dedicated to the Z-Wave chip firmware. The manufacturer MUST assign a version and sub version number

The Number of Firmware Targets field MUST report the number of firmware Version plus Sub Version fields following this field (Firmware 1â¦.n).
  • The Firmware 0 Version fields are not included.
  • The field MUST be zero if the device only implements a Firmware 0 target for the Z-Wave chip.

formItem.itemHeader: The following fields are required for all additional firmware targets.
Provide the values returned in the Manufacturer Specific report in this section. All values are 16 bits (Hex); example: 0x0A01
formItem.itemNote: The Manufacturer ID referenced here is assigned by Silicon Labs. Please send a request to the Z-Wave Certification e-mail address if your company needs one assigned.

formItem.itemHeader: The Product Type ID and Prod ID numbers are assigned by the manufacturer and are intended for use in identifying and differentiating various products from the same manufacturer. These numbers MUST be unique for each device being certified. All values are 16 bits (Hex); example: 0x0A01
formItem.itemNote: The Product Type ID field MUST carry a unique ID identifying the actual product type. A specific Product Type ID MUST be defined by the manufacturer for each type of product.

The Product ID field MUST carry a unique ID identifying the actual product. A specific Product ID MUST be defined by the manufacturer for each product of a given product type. The same Product ID value may appear for different Product Type ID values.

formItem.itemHeader: Provide the values returned in the Z-Wave Plus Info report in this section. All values are 16 bits (Hex); example: 0x0A01
formItem.itemNote: The Z-Wave Plus Info Command Class is used to differentiate between Z-Wave Plus v2, Z-Wave Plus, Z-Wave for IP and Z-Wave devices. The Z-Wave Plus Info Command Class also defines two icon types that allow for a meaningful representation in user and installer Graphical User Interfaces (GUI). A Z-Wave Plus v2 product MUST specify valid icon types; however the manufacturer can freely choose suitable icon types for their product among those available on the Z-Wave Alliance website.

formItem.itemTitle: This is a Z-Wave hardware device without application software

formItem.itemNote:
• The Hardware Device Version Number is not a programmed value.
  • The Hardware Device Version Number is typically something like a final PCB revision number or identifying number printed on the enclosure.

formItem.itemDescription: Product exposes Z-Wave Plus standard Serial API to applications

formItem.itemTitle: The DUT is based on a 500 series Z-Wave chip.

formItem.itemDescription: The NVR flash page is used to store NVM data throughout a Z-Wave productâs lifetime. The Z-Wave protocol and peripheral drivers utilize some of the NVR data for RF calibration data and for data that can be used to identify the peripherals. A part of the NVR data area can be used by the application, e.g. for calibration data, serial numbers etc. The fields in the Z-Wave protocol and peripheral driver part (addresses 0x10-0x7F) of the NVR flash page, NVR0, are divided in fields that are mandatory to be set, fields that are conditionally mandatory to be set and in fields that can be set as an option. It is the Z-Wave end-product manufacturer's responsibility to program the fields correctly. The NVR flash page specification is covered in 500 Series Z-Wave Chip NVR Flash Page Contents (SDS12467).
formItem.itemNote: Although the NVR data can be read from the MCU embedded in the 500 series chip, it is not feasible for the test house to do this. Screen captures from the programmerâs interface MUST be provided to the test house for verification that all of the mandatory fields have been programmed with valid values. This screen capture can be uploaded as a general file in the summary section page of this certification case.

formItem.itemDescription: REV â NVR layout revision (8 bit)
NVMCS â NVM Chip Select (8 bit)
formItem.itemNote: Valid Values: 0xFF or 0xXY where X=Port Number, Y=Pin number

formItem.itemDescription: SAWC â SAW Center Frequency (24 bit)
NVMP â Non-Volatile-Memory Page Size (16 bit)
UUID â Universally Unique Identifier (128 bit)
VID â USB Vendor ID (16 bit)
PID â USB Product ID (16 bit)
The CCAL field contains a valid value (CCAL MUST not be 0x80)
